venomous-ui.title: Venomous UI Library
venomous-ui.subtitle: Cross-framework UI Component Library ( React / Vue )
venomous-ui.description: An unstyled-by-default, zero-runtime-CSS component library providing a unified API across React and Vue, with a Design Token system powered by CSS Custom Properties.
overview: Not built to compete with Headless UI — built to validate whether a single component API can genuinely be shared across React and Vue without sacrificing each framework's idioms. Motivated by recurring cross-framework styling inconsistencies and maintenance overhead encountered at work.

Architecture separates a framework-agnostic core (types, constants, Design Tokens, CSS) from idiomatic React and Vue adapters. Every component is covered by Vitest tests and documented interactively in Storybook.

achievements.title: Cross-framework Unified Architecture
achievements.description: Shared core layer with framework-specific adapters — adding a component means only writing the React/Vue differential.
highlights: Separated Vite build pipeline per entry point (core / react / vue)

achievements.title: Unstyled by Default + Design Token System
achievements.description: Components emit semantic class names only; styles are opt-in per component. Theming is handled entirely through CSS Custom Properties.
highlights: 5 semantic color schemes with full spacing/typography/effect scales
Tree-shakeable — unused component styles never enter the bundle

achievements.title: Quality & Documentation
achievements.description: Every component covered by Vitest + Testing Library / Vue Test Utils, with interactive Storybook docs for each variant and state.
highlights: ESLint 9 + Stylelint + Prettier + Husky pre-commit pipeline
Storybook deployed as a living style guide
